Description: Four fragments of an ebony label: joining to form two larger pieces. One side of the label is inscribed, and there was a perforation at the top right-hand corner for attachment. The upper part bears the remains of the incised serekh of Aḥa, opposite a scene showing boats and a religious sanctuary, perhaps Temple of Neith at Sais. On the lower fragments are traces of another religious building, a row of boats and place names and the name of the type of oil to which the label referred, together with its quantity.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Abydos, cemetery B tomb B18 and B19
Curator's comments: The upper fragments are marked B.18 and the lower B.19. A similar label, also from Abydos, completes the missing portions of this example, see Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls. IIIA, 5; X, 2; H. Ranke, 'The Egyptian Collections of the University Museum Philadelphia' (1950), fig. 11; F. Legge, ‘Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology’ 29 (London,1907), pl. opp. p.24, no. 2; J. Vandier, 'Manuel d'Archeologie egyptienne', I, (2), 836-40 and fig. 560. The scenes on these two labels have been considered to refer to the visit of Aḥa to the temple of Neith at Sais. and to the creation of the ỉmy-wt symbol; see the discussions in the above references and also R. Weill, ‘Recherches sur la première dynastie et les temps prépharaoniques I (Cairo, 1961) , 157; R. Weill, ‘Recherches sur la première dynastie et les temps prépharaoniques II (Cairo, 1961), 1-5, 48-9: V. Vikentiev, 'Annales du Service des Antiquitiés de l'Égypte' 41 (1942), 285-7; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit' II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 989, n. 1565; Sethe, 'Untersuchungen' III, 62; G. Jequier, ‘Bulletin de l’Institut Français d’Archéologie Orientale’ 6(Cairo, 1908), 27-31; W. S. Smith, 'History of Egyptian Sculpture and Painting in the Old Kingdom' (London, 1946), 120, no. 4. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls. IIIA, 6; XI, 2; F. Legge, ‘Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology’ 29 (London, 1907), pl. opp. p.24, no. 3; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit' II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 981, n. 1552 - ‘ḥʒ b 2.
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Temple of Neith (?)
